reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I adored this magical, mystical, and enchanting book!
reviews.reviewText: 💜 “ℍ𝕠𝕝𝕕 𝕠𝕟 𝕥𝕠 𝕙𝕠𝕡𝕖 𝕟𝕠 𝕞𝕒𝕥𝕥𝕖𝕣 𝕥𝕙𝕖 𝕔𝕠𝕤𝕥, 𝕓𝕖𝕔𝕒𝕦𝕤𝕖 𝕒𝕤 𝕝𝕠𝕟𝕘 𝕥𝕙𝕖𝕣𝕖’𝕤 𝕙𝕠𝕡𝕖, 𝕖𝕧𝕖𝕣𝕪𝕥𝕙𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕖𝕝𝕤𝕖 𝕚𝕤 𝕛𝕦𝕤𝕥 𝕥𝕙𝕖 𝕦𝕟𝕗𝕠𝕣𝕥𝕦𝕟𝕒𝕥𝕖 𝕤𝕚𝕕𝕖 𝕖𝕗𝕗𝕖𝕔𝕥𝕤 𝕠𝕗 𝕙𝕖𝕒𝕣𝕥𝕓𝕣𝕖𝕒𝕜 𝕒𝕟𝕕 𝕞𝕒𝕘𝕚𝕔.” ✨Synopsis: As the legacy goes, every member of the Revelare family has magic, but unfortunately it is accompanied by a curse. Sadie Revelare learned of her curse at thirteen. It is that of four heartbreaks 💔, each one which will be worse than the last. Her grandmother advised her to love only as she is willing to lose her magic. From that day, she held her magic close and built walls around her heart.Now at age 29, Sadie has already been through two devastating heartbreaks. The third happens when her grandmother is diagnosed with cancer and only has weeks to live. Sadie’s carefully orchestrated life spirals with the diagnosis, her first heartbreak Jake McNealy returning to town after a decade, and her estranged twin brother Seth coming home (carrying dark family secrets) after abandoning her for a year.With only one heartbreak left, Sadie needs to decide if love is more important than magic. Will she allow herself to fully rekindle her feelings for Jake? Will the secrets Seth reveals tear her and her family apart?⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️I adored this magical, mystical, and enchanting book! It was written with so many emotions, and I literally felt every single one. One moment I was crying and the next I was laughing… and everything in-between. All. The. Feels. If you love the curse aspect of Practical Magic and Lorelai & Luke’s relationship in Gilmore Girls, this book is for you!💜 Romantasy✨ Second Chance Love💜 Slow Burn✨ Dark Family Secrets💜 Family Relationship Dynamics✨ Healing ❤️‍🩹 (Mental Health Rep)💜 Small Town✨ Enchanted Garden 🌱💜 Magical Bakery✨ Yummy Recipes 😋

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great read - but know it's not all fun and Halloween
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book. Dubbed a Practical Magic meets Gilmore Girls book, and it absolutely lives up to that. While you don't get a witty Lorelei character we do get a cozy town and an eccentrically loving family dynamic.This book cover a lot of ground in 322 pages. While I didn't go into expecting a cozy witchy story it packed much more of an emotional punch than I expected.I really related with Sadie. Right or wrong I can admit to behaving like her in that age range. I absolutely adored Gigi and her "piss ant" calling ways.The author did an amazing job creating detailed imagery with the herbs and oils and recepies but then sped through the ending . The book ended well, but rushed. I would have loved a bit more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cozy Fall Read That’s Just Okay
reviews.reviewText: I pre-ordered this book after seeing it hyped so much on social media and I was so excited to read it. I wouldn’t necessarily describe it as “Gilmore Girls,” although I think it got that reputation from the small town setting and the grandmother, Gigi, whose dialogue reads like Babette. I would say that it is a nice, simple, cozy fall read for a rainy day. There was nothing very special about this book for me, although there were elements that I did enjoy:Pros:• The magic - I liked that with each person’s magic comes a curse and that everyone’s magic is different.• The recipes at the end of each chapter. Very cute and unexpected.• I thought the romance ending between Sadie and Jake, while predictable, was decent. I like a good second chance romance.• Gigi’s rules were so cute- I would have loved a master list somewhere in the book to look at them all.Cons:• I was not expecting the religious aspect. It was odd and forced in my opinion- almost bordering on preachy. Definitely not for me, but everyone is different.• The main character Sadie was completely unlikeable. She had no real believable growth and no real lessons were learned.• I understand the ending was probably left open for possible sequels, but the ending was lackluster and dissatisfying.• The first 1/3 of the book was slow and disorganized. It could have done with a lot of editing. But the story and action did pick up.• The romance was extremely predictable. Between the main characters and others. Which is fine, but there are zero surprises. Absolutely nothing to keep anyone guessing.Honestly, the story is cute. There are some very glaring technical problems with this novel, but if you can get passed that, it’s fine. For me personally, I didn’t enjoy it as much as I anticipated I would. However, I would still recommend this book to people who are looking for a book to get them in to the fall/October spirit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Read, Great Recipes, Great Storyline
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. It’s like how the author describes it with a Practical Magic/Gilmore Girls vibe. I enjoyed all the characters and hope another book is written to continue the stories of the Revelare family. The recipes at the end of the chapters was an unexpected but pleasant surprise. Can’t wait to try some of them. The plot is good, character’s descriptions were excellent. This was a book I had to put down due to work obligations, but was able to pick right back up in the storyline. Would highly recommended for folks who are wanting a good read. Hope the author writes more books, because I’m now a huge fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Light, Entertaining, Diverting
reviews.reviewText: This book is a light and enjoyable story of magic, heartbreak, romance, and recipes. I enjoyed it. It was a welcome respite for taking a break from a very serious and depressing book filled with starvation, suffering and poverty. It was fun that each member of the family had a different type of magic. And that each type of magic was offset by a curse that was intended to make some sort of karmic balance. This book will not change your life, it would not be a book group book for my group, and it did not make me a better person, but not every book needs to. It was enough for it to be distracting and entertaining even if I am unlikely to remember much about it. The romance is fairly chaste, the language is fairly mild, and there is no gory violence. Dramatic tension is provided by the need to defeat a curse before the expiration of a time deadline and some romantic complications.
I loved this book, it had everything in it. It brought out all the emotions. I was cheering for Sadie and Seth and the rest of them. A great debut novel, can't wait for the authors next one

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was pulled in and stayed up far too late reading into the night. Magical, warm, real, delicious. Thank you Breanne it was delightful xx

Doesn't live up to the hype. It's not bad -bad, 😕 but it feels a little rough around the edges. There are a lot of illogical parts.I think that's the danger, when a book is super hyped on Book- Tok you have certain expectations....
It was a great story wish it was a series.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to read anytime but Perfect for Fall
reviews.reviewText: This book has all the feels for fall. It's warm, comforting and has mystery.It definitely lives up to the Gilmore Girls and Practical Magic that you're hoping for.The only storyline I struggled with was the issue between Jake and Sadie...but that was fixed by the end.The family dynamic is so strong and is all centered around the amazing Gigi.I laughed, yelled and cried through this book.
